intro: Hesperis velenovskyi, commonly known as the Velenovsky's honesty, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many mustard plants. The plant produces small, white, four-petaled flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in a fine layer of hair. Hesperis velenovskyi is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
